meanings.sent1: She decided to revoice her opinion during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The singer will revoice the chorus for the final performance.
meanings.sent3: After the misunderstanding, he had to revoice his explanation.
meanings.sent4: The teacher asked the student to revoice the answer in a clearer way.
meanings.sent5: The radio host had to revoice the announcement due to technical issues.

meanings.definition: The act of giving voice to something again.
meanings.sent1: The revoicing of the story brought new life to the characters.
meanings.sent2: Her revoicing of the poem added depth to the emotional impact.
meanings.sent3: The revoicing of the old legend made the listeners smile.
meanings.sent4: The revoicing of the speech captivated the audience's attention.
meanings.sent5: His revoicing of the joke made everyone burst into laughter.

meanings.definition: The process of changing the voice of a musical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The revoicing of the piano gave it a brighter tone.
meanings.sent2: The technician performed a revoicing on the guitar to enhance its sound.
meanings.sent3: The revoicing of the violin made it sound like a different instrument.
meanings.sent4: The revoicing of the saxophone created a unique musical texture.
meanings.sent5: The revoicing of the trumpet made it stand out in the orchestra.
